arm_group.description: This arm will perform the pulmonary rehabilitation as specified with no respiratory assistance.
This arm will conduct the pulmonary rehabilitation program with BiLevel Noninvasive Ventilation assistance from a ResMed ventilator.

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial hopes to demonstrate the effect of 4 weeks of outpatient exercise rehabilitation
      on COPD patients. In particular the effect on:

        -  the amount of daily physical activity

        -  Quality of life

        -  The 6-minute walk distance

        -  Time to exacerbation

      and compare it to the effect of 4 weeks of outpatients rehabilitation with Noninvasive
      Ventilation as an adjunct therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of NIV on QoL and Exercise Capacity in a COPD Exercise Rehabilitation Program

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Diagnosis of COPD III+IV

          -  Age >18 years

          -  Former NIV treatment for at least 6 weeks with a positive end-expiratory pressure of
             at least 4 cmH2O and a pressure support of 8 cmH2O or higher

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pulmonary Exacerbation requiring antibiotic treatment or hospitalization during the
             last 6 weeks

          -  non-pulmonary Exercise impairment (amputation, severe heart disease, etc)

          -  any disease that precludes exercise training

          -  inability to understand the patient information

          -  substance abuse

          -  oxygen requirement of more than 6l O2/min during exercise

intervention.description: Positive pressure applied through an oro-nasal mask. The pressure is altered between inspiration and expiration.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of BiLevel Pressure Support NonInvasive Ventilation on Quality of Life and Exercise Capacity in a COPD Exercise Rehabilitation Program

other_outcome.description: The average time to exacerbation between groups will be analysed post trial.

authority: Germany: Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices
Australia: Department of Health and Ageing Therapeutic Goods Administration

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome will be measured by daily activity using accelerometer arm bands. This will be measured at the beginning of the rehabilitation program, at the end and at a 3 month follow up.
6 Minute Walking Distance will be measured every week during the exercise program.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Using the St. George Respiratory Questionnaire before and after rehabilitation, quality of life will be measured.
Change in Dyspnoea after end of exercise will be assessed using the Multidimensional Dyspnoea Profile and the BORG scale.
Maximum training intensity, body weight and muscle diameter will be tracked throughout the training program.
